Subject: Running JUnit from Ant, the easy way

Message-ID: <B6A307DA.4550%toddster@...>
Mime-version: 1.0
Content-type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"

X-eGroups-From: Todd Jonker <toddster@...>
From: Todd Jonker <tvj@...>

Hi everyone, especially Perry,

Please note that the article you mention, "Incremental development with Ant
and JUnit", is a bit outdated in that it doesn't make use of the <junit>
task that is now shipped as part of the Optional Tasks set in Ant.

Using the <junit> task, you don't need to write a main() method anywhere,
and Ant will properly fail if any of your unit tests fail.

See the "optional tasks" page of the Ant documentation for more details.

Cheers,
.T.
subject: Running JUnit from Ant, the easy way
